definition: to listen and obey/to comply with/to heed/to hearken
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
surname Cong

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: When you have and hold a need, harken not to others greed.
sentences.chinese: 当你有需求的时候，不要听从他人贪婪的想法。

sentences.english: Why should Horus now do as the Emperor bids?
sentences.chinese: 为什么何鲁斯现在还要听从帝皇的吩咐？

sentences.english: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
sentences.chinese: 惟有听从我的，必安然居住，得享安静，不怕灾祸。

sentences.english: When your parents need to instruct you, respectfully do as you're told.
sentences.chinese: 父母教导我们时，必须恭敬地听从。

sentences.english: Some presidents, though, didn't always follow Mesnier's advice.
sentences.chinese: 不过，有些总统也并不全听从梅斯尼尔的建议。

sentences.english: Listen to your heart for guidance.
sentences.chinese: 听从你的内心，以此为指引。

sentences.english: As for the word that thou hast spoken unto us in the name of the LORD, we will not hearken unto thee.
sentences.chinese: 论到你奉耶和华的名向我们所说的话，我们必不听从。

sentences.english: As a consequence, people willingly and wholeheartedly give themselves to what she asks of them.
sentences.chinese: 因此，人们心甘情愿地全心全意地听从她的请求。

sentences.english: Children, obey your parents in the Lord: for this is right.
sentences.chinese: 你们作儿女的，要在主里听从父母，这是理所当然的。

sentences.english: But they, our forefathers, became arrogant and stiff-necked, and did not obey your commands.
sentences.chinese: 但我们的列祖行事狂傲，硬着颈项不听从你的诫命。

sentences.english: Nobody obeyed the teacher's commmand to stop chatting.
sentences.chinese: 老师制止学生聊天，却无人听从。

sentences.english: But the Benjamites would not listen to their fellow Israelites.
sentences.chinese: 便雅悯人却不肯听从他们弟兄以色列人的话。

sentences.english: Who is among you that feareth Jehovah, that obeyeth the voice of his servant?
sentences.chinese: 你们中间谁是敬畏耶和华听从祂仆人之话的。

sentences.english: At Lola's advice she had had some pictures taken by Sarony.
sentences.chinese: 她听从萝拉的劝告，曾经请萨罗尼为她拍了几张照片。

sentences.english: They accepted his advice and rescinded the original plan.
sentences.chinese: 他们听从了他的劝告，撤销了原计划。

sentences.english: I have obeyed the LORD my God; I have done everything you commanded me.
sentences.chinese: 我听从了耶和华我神的话，都照你所吩咐的行了。

definition: to obey (an order)/to comply/to defer
to comply with/to follow (directives)/to defer (to the judgment of superiors)
to advise/to urge/to exhort/exhortation/advice/CL:席[xi2]
in accordance with/to follow (the rules)
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
obedient/to comply/to submit/to defer
to allow (sb to do as he pleases)
to disobey
to obey/to observe/to follow
obstinately clinging to one's course (idiom)/willful/one's own way/dogmatic
to let (sth happen)/to allow (sb to do sth)/to submit to/to yield
to follow the rules/to do as instructed/to play by the book/to comply with a request
to point out/to indicate/to instruct/directives/instructions/CL:個|个[ge4]
to follow/(of a woman) to get married/(old) attendant
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
order/command/CL:道[dao4],個|个[ge4]
